**Black dragon scales** are a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Black dragon scales are not randomly generated, though they can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").

A [black dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon") that leaves a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") behind on death (i.e., always) have a 1⁄3 chance of leaving behind dragon scales, while a dragon revived by the [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning") or [spell of turn undead](/wiki/Spell_of_turn_undead "Spell of turn undead") only has a 1⁄20 chance to leave behind scales.[\[1\]](#cite_note-scalegen-1) Black dragon scales dropped this way are always generated +0 and uncursed.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, black dragon scales confer 3 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance"). Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn black dragon scales will convert them into [black dragon scale mail](/wiki/Black_dragon_scale_mail "Black dragon scale mail"), with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing black dragon scales will turn the wearer into a black dragon, and doing so while wearing the scale mail will additionally revert them to scales.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scales#Strategy](/wiki/Dragon_scales#Strategy "Dragon scales")*

Black dragon scales are rarely sought out by most characters: as [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") is sufficient enough to protect a character against most forms of disintegration minus the [wide-angle disintegration beam](/wiki/Wide-angle_disintegration_beam "Wide-angle disintegration beam"), which is only encountered through either deliberate action or severe missteps. In the former case, it can be used to survive a god's smiting for bragging rights as with black dragon scale mail.

A player going without reflection may consider grabbing black dragon scales, but will need to take significant measures to make sure they are not hit by the black dragon's [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") from off-screen, as well as keeping a black dragon in melee range to avoid them using their breath further. Additionally, once killed their corpse can be eaten or made into a [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") via [tinning kit](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit"), and fully consuming either renders disintegration a non-issue for the rest of that game. The scales can still be given to a pet if a character is not willing to spare a source of reflection or else lacks any others.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Black dragon scales are more likely to be considered for characters and pets since it confers a source of drain resistance, which is very difficult to obtain outside of [polyself](/wiki/Polyself "Polyself") or [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact").

## History

Black dragon scales first appear with most other colors of dragon scales in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund - instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give black dragon scales additional properties while worn, and variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make black dragon scales and other colors more worthwhile.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn black dragon scales can [passively](/wiki/Passive "Passive") [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") attackers.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon.

Black dragon scales are effectively replaced by **disintegration dragon scales**, which confer only 1 base AC like all dragon scales in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn black dragon scales additionally confer drain resistance. Dragon scales also weigh 150 aum.

The [Chromatic Dragon Scales](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Chromatic_Dragon_Scales "DNetHack artifacts") are an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") set of black dragon scales that can be obtained from the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon"), the [Caveman quest](/wiki/Caveman_quest "Caveman quest") nemesis who can also appear within [Gehennom](/index.php?title=Gehennom_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gehennom (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") in 1⁄8 of games for other roles. These scales can be converted into a chromatic dragon scale mail or shield as with other scales. While worn in any form, Chromatic Dragon Scales grant [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), [sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance"), [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"), with all properties capable of affecting dragon breath like typical dragon armor.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn black dragon scales additionally confer drain resistance, and weigh 300 aum like all dragon scales in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

## References
